titles: The iudgment of humane actions a most learned, & excellent treatise of morrall philosophie, which fights agaynst vanytie, & conduceth to the fyndinge out of true and perfect felicytie. Written in French by Monsieur Leonard Marrande and Englished by Iohn Reynolds
author: Marandé, Léonard de.
Cecil, Thomas, fl. 1630, engraver.
Reynolds, John, fl. 1621-1650.
publisher: Imprinted by A. Mathewes for Nicholas Bourne, at ye Royall Exchange,
notes: A translation of: Jugement des actions humaines.
The title page is engraved and signed: T Cecill sculp.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Conduct of life --  Early works to 1900.
